result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:32 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Hareshkumar R. Chaudhary. Defendant Hareshkumar R. Chaudhary in court. Victim witness in court. Victim appeared via zoom. Interpreter Samina Charania appeared via zoom. Includes 22CF56 and 22CF356. DE request interpreter to stand by incase DE has questions. Interpreter stands by. Court reviews case. Atty Wilhelm request another STC due to not receiving discovery in another case. ADA Smestad states got a few pages from IL (22-OP-9) re: protection order and is going to try and receive full details. Court sets STC. Interpreter confirmed. Court confirms address. Adjourned 10:38 AM
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:07 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Benoy   Defendant Hareshkumar R. Chaudhary in court.  Interpreter Samina Charania appeared by phone.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Wilhelm in court for Hareshkumar R. Chaudhary.   INCLUDES: 22CF56 & 22CF356    Both cases are set for arraignment.  Motion to modify bond has also been filed.  In both cases: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   Atty Wilhelm requests to take up the motion filed on 7/7/22.  DF wishes to travel to TN and have his passport returned.  State objects - believes he is a flight risk.  States that the victim also objects.  Atty Wilhelm bond argument.  Court unwilling to modify bond as requested today.  Court denies motion.  Atty Wilhem requests to be heard on the motion filed on 7/13/22.  Requesting DF have contact with his own children. DF is subject to a court order in IL regarding his children.  State has not had a chance to talk to the victims regarding this request.  Requests time to do so.  Court will withhold finding regarding this motion.  Court requests more information regarding the IL case.   Court confirms address.  Adjourned: 4:37
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.   Interpreter not confirmed.

records.addlTxt: of interpreter. ks
Gujarati interpreter needed. ks
Arraignment on June 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF56 & 22CF356 (PH):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Hareshkumar R. Chaudhary appeared from jail. Witness appears via zoom. Victim participation via zoom. Interpreter Samina Charania appears via zoom. Case called at 1:47 p.m. Oath of Interpreter given at 1:49 p.m. Court notes these matters are scheduled for a preliminary hearing. In 22CF56, ADA Smestad calls Whitney M. to testify whom appears via zoom. S/T Whitney M. Direct by ADA Smestad. Cross by Atty Satorius. Redirect by ADA Smestad. Rebuttal by Atty Satorius. Witness excused at 2:29 p.m. ADA Smestad calls Officer Garden to the Stand. S/T Joe Garden. Employed with the Village of Baldwin Police Department. Direct by ADA Smestad. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Satorius. Witness excused. On 22CF356, State calls Shelby H. to the Stand. S/T Shelby H. Employed with St Croix County Justice Support Services. Direct by ADA Smestad. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record will reflect identification. Cross by Atty Satorius. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. ADA Smestad gives argument. In 22CF56, Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Satorius gives argument. Rebuttal by ADA Smestad. In 22CF356, Court finds evidence is sufficient and binds DE over for trial. Court will schedule for arraignment. Also, DE to be aware that the Public Defender Office is reviewing eligibility. If PD's office will no longer represent, may apply for Court appointed counsel, hire private counsel or represent self. PFAC is given to DE in Court. DE does not have any questions regarding rights to an attorney. Atty Satorius addresses bond on 22CF356. Requesting reduced amount. ADA Smestad objects. Gives argument. Court DENIES bond modification request at this time. Needs more information regarding place of residence and employment before. Court adjourned at 3:28 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

per SJN. hml

Faxed to Dispatch, Quash Sheriff & Jail
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Prohibited from presence in playgrounds, schools, parks and daycares

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device. Geographic Restriction of no more than 100 miles from Hudson, WI. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.


If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Liddle, ADA:   Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius for purposes of today  DF:  Hareshkumar R. Chaudhary appeared from jail. Case called at 1:09 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint. Atty Satorius represents DE on other file. Does not know if qualifies for PD services on this file. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Court will administratively transfer to Branch 4. QUASH WARRANT. Case recalled at 1:29 p.m. Court addresses attorney issue. Atty Satorius will speak to DE. Spoke to DE regarding time limits. If there is an issue finding counsel, DE waives time limits if additional time is needed to find counsel. Court adjourned at 1:31 p.m.   Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
